declarations.description:
A flexible bar component that handles overflow gracefully.

Items are slotted children. The bar measures which items fit on the first
row and handles overflow according to the `overflow` prop.
declarations.name: LeBar

slots.description: Bar items (children will be measured for overflow)

members.name: overflow
members.description:
Overflow behavior when items don't fit on one row.
- `more`: Overflow items appear in a "more" dropdown
- `scroll`: Items scroll horizontally with optional arrows
- `hamburger`: All items go into a hamburger menu if any overflow
- `wrap`: Items wrap to additional rows

members.name: alignItems
members.description: Alignment of items within the bar (maps to justify-content).

members.name: arrows
members.description: Show scroll arrows when overflow is "scroll".

members.name: disablePopover
members.description:
Disable the internal overflow popover.
When true, the bar still detects overflow and hides items,
but doesn't render its own popover. Use this when providing
custom overflow handling via the leBarOverflowChange event.

members.name: minVisibleItems
members.description:
Minimum number of visible items required when using "more" overflow mode.
If fewer items would be visible, the bar falls back to hamburger mode.
Only applies when overflow is "more".

members.name: showAllMenu
members.description:
Show an "all items" menu button.
- `false`: Don't show
- `true` or `'end'`: Show at end
- `'start'`: Show at start

members.name: popoverOpen
members.description: Whether the hamburger/more popover is open

members.name: hamburgerActive
members.description: Whether hamburger mode is active (for hamburger overflow)

members.name: overflowingIds
members.description: IDs of items that are overflowing

members.name: canScrollStart
members.description: Whether we can scroll left

members.name: canScrollEnd
members.description: Whether we can scroll right

members.name: allMenuOpen
members.description: Whether the all-menu popover is open

members.name: containerHeight
members.description: Current height of the items container (for overflow handling)

members.name: recalculate
members.description: Force recalculation of overflow state.

attributes.name: overflow
attributes.description:
Overflow behavior when items don't fit on one row.
- `more`: Overflow items appear in a "more" dropdown
- `scroll`: Items scroll horizontally with optional arrows
- `hamburger`: All items go into a hamburger menu if any overflow
- `wrap`: Items wrap to additional rows

attributes.name: align-items
attributes.description: Alignment of items within the bar (maps to justify-content).

attributes.name: arrows
attributes.description: Show scroll arrows when overflow is "scroll".

attributes.name: disable-popover
attributes.description:
Disable the internal overflow popover.
When true, the bar still detects overflow and hides items,
but doesn't render its own popover. Use this when providing
custom overflow handling via the leBarOverflowChange event.

attributes.name: min-visible-items
attributes.description:
Minimum number of visible items required when using "more" overflow mode.
If fewer items would be visible, the bar falls back to hamburger mode.
Only applies when overflow is "more".

attributes.name: show-all-menu
attributes.description:
Show an "all items" menu button.
- `false`: Don't show
- `true` or `'end'`: Show at end
- `'start'`: Show at start

events.name: leBarOverflowChange
events.description: Emitted when overflow state changes.

declarations.description:
A flexible box component for use as a flex item within le-stack.

`le-box` wraps content and provides flex item properties like grow, shrink,
basis, and self-alignment. It can also control its internal content alignment.
declarations.name: LeBox

members.name: grow
members.description: Flex grow factor - how much the item should grow relative to siblings

members.name: shrink
members.description: Flex shrink factor - how much the item should shrink relative to siblings

members.name: basis
members.description: Flex basis - initial size before growing/shrinking (e.g., '200px', '25%', 'auto')

members.name: width
members.description: Width of the box (CSS value like '100px', '50%', 'auto')

members.name: height
members.description: Height of the box (CSS value)

members.name: minWidth
members.description: Minimum width constraint

members.name: maxWidth
members.description: Maximum width constraint

members.name: minHeight
members.description: Minimum height constraint

members.name: maxHeight
members.description: Maximum height constraint

members.name: background
members.description: Background color or CSS value (e.g., '#f0f0f0', 'var(--le-color-primary-light)')

members.name: borderRadius
members.description: Border radius (e.g., '8px', 'var(--le-radius-md)')

members.name: border
members.description: Border style (e.g., '1px solid #ccc', '2px dashed var(--le-color-border)')

members.name: alignSelf
members.description: Self-alignment override for this item on the cross axis

members.name: alignContent
members.description: Internal horizontal alignment of content

members.name: justifyContent
members.description: Internal vertical alignment of content

members.name: padding
members.description: Padding inside the box (CSS value like '8px', '1rem')

members.name: order
members.description: Order in the flex container (lower values come first)

members.name: displayFlex
members.description: Whether to display box content as flex (for internal alignment)

members.name: innerDirection
members.description: Direction of internal flex layout when displayFlex is true

members.name: innerGap
members.description: Gap between internal flex items when displayFlex is true

attributes.description: Flex grow factor - how much the item should grow relative to siblings

attributes.name: shrink
attributes.description: Flex shrink factor - how much the item should shrink relative to siblings

attributes.name: basis
attributes.description: Flex basis - initial size before growing/shrinking (e.g., '200px', '25%', 'auto')

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: Width of the box (CSS value like '100px', '50%', 'auto')

declarations.description:
A flexible card component with header, content, and footer slots.

The card uses le-slot wrappers for each slot area. In admin mode,
le-slot shows placeholders for CMS editing. In default mode,
le-slot acts as a transparent passthrough.
declarations.name: LeCard

slots.description: Default slot for main card content

members.name: interactive
members.description: Whether the card is interactive (clickable)

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description: Card variant style

attributes.name: interactive
attributes.description: Whether the card is interactive (clickable)

declarations.description:
Animated show/hide wrapper.

Supports height collapse (auto->0) and/or fading.
Can optionally listen to the nearest `le-header` shrink events.
declarations.name: LeCollapse

members.name: closed
members.description:
Since Stencil boolean props default to `false` when the attribute is missing.
instead of `open` defaulting to `true`, using a `closed` prop.

members.name: scrollDown
members.description: Whether the content should scroll down from the top when open.

members.name: noFading
members.description: Stop fading the content when collapsing/expanding.

members.name: collapseOnHeaderShrink
members.description: If true, collapse/expand based on the nearest header shrink event.

members.name: handleHeaderShrink
members.description:
Handles `leHeaderShrinkChange` events from the `le-header`.
In case multiple headers are present, only the nearest one in the DOM tree is used.

attributes.name: closed
attributes.description:
Since Stencil boolean props default to `false` when the attribute is missing.
instead of `open` defaulting to `true`, using a `closed` prop.

attributes.name: scroll-down
attributes.description: Whether the content should scroll down from the top when open.

attributes.name: no-fading
attributes.description: Stop fading the content when collapsing/expanding.

attributes.name: collapse-on-header-shrink
attributes.description: If true, collapse/expand based on the nearest header shrink event.

declarations.description:
Component wrapper for admin mode editing.

This component is used internally by other components to provide admin-mode
editing capabilities. It wraps the component's rendered output and shows
a settings popover for editing properties.

In default mode, it acts as a simple passthrough (display: contents).
In admin mode, it shows a border, component name header, and settings popover.

The host element is found automatically by traversing up through the shadow DOM.

Usage inside a component's render method:
```tsx
render() {
  return (
    <le-component component="le-card">
      <Host>...</Host>
    </le-component>
  );
}
```
declarations.name: LeComponent

members.name: component
members.description:
The tag name of the component (e.g., 'le-card').
Used to look up property metadata and display the component name.

members.name: displayName
members.description:
Optional display name for the component.
If not provided, the tag name will be formatted as the display name.

members.name: hostClass
members.description:
Classes to apply to the host element.
Allows parent components to pass their styling classes.

members.name: hostStyle
members.description:
Inline styles to apply to the host element.
Allows parent components to pass dynamic styles (e.g., flex properties).

members.name: hostElement
members.description: Reference to the host element (found automatically from parent)

members.name: adminMode
members.description: Internal state to track admin mode

members.name: componentMeta
members.description: Component metadata loaded from Custom Elements Manifest

members.name: propertyValues
members.description: Current property values of the host component

members.name: findHostElement
members.description: Find the host element by traversing up through shadow DOM

members.name: formatDisplayName
members.description:
Formats a tag name into a display name
e.g., 'le-card' -> 'Card'

members.name: loadComponentMetadata
members.description: Load component metadata from the Custom Elements Manifest

members.name: isInternalAttribute
members.description: Check if an attribute is internal (should not be shown in editor)

members.name: readPropertyValues
members.description: Read current property values from the host element

members.name: parseAttributeValue
members.description: Parse an attribute value based on its type

members.name: handlePropertyChange
members.description: Handle property value changes from the editor

members.name: deleteComponent
members.description: Delete this component from the DOM

members.name: renderPropertyEditor
members.description: Render the property editor form

members.name: renderPropertyField
members.description: Render a single property field based on its type

attributes.name: component
attributes.description:
The tag name of the component (e.g., 'le-card').
Used to look up property metadata and display the component name.

attributes.name: display-name
attributes.description:
Optional display name for the component.
If not provided, the tag name will be formatted as the display name.

attributes.name: host-class
attributes.description:
Classes to apply to the host element.
Allows parent components to pass their styling classes.

attributes.name: host-style
attributes.description:
Inline styles to apply to the host element.
Allows parent components to pass dynamic styles (e.g., flex properties).

Combines a text input with a dropdown list, allowing users to
filter options by typing or select from the list.

declarations.description:
Shows a "smart" header title based on what has scrolled out of view.

When `selector` matches multiple elements, the title becomes the last element
(top-to-bottom) that has fully scrolled out above the viewport.
declarations.name: LeCurrentHeading

slots.description: Optional fallback content if no watched title is active

members.name: selector
members.description: CSS selector for page title/headings to watch (e.g. `.page-title`, `main h2`).

attributes.description: CSS selector for page title/headings to watch (e.g. `.page-title`, `main h2`).

declarations.description:
Internal dropdown base component that provides shared functionality
for select, combobox, and multiselect components.

Wraps le-popover for positioning and provides:
- Option list rendering with groups
- Keyboard navigation (, Enter, Escape, Home/End)
- Option filtering support
- Single and multi-select modes
declarations.name: LeDropdownBase

members.name: disabled

Filter function for options.

declarations.description:
A functional page header with scroll-aware behaviors.

Features:
- Static (default), sticky, or fixed positioning
- Optional shrink-on-scroll behavior via `shrink-offset`
- Optional reveal-on-scroll-up via `reveal-on-scroll` (sticky only)

Slots:
- `start`: left side (logo/back button)
- `title`: centered/primary title content
- `end`: right side actions
- default: extra content row (e.g., tabs/search) rendered below main row
declarations.name: LeHeader

members.name: isStatic
members.description: Force static positioning (default). Ignored if `sticky` or `fixed` are true.

members.name: sticky
members.description: Sticky positioning (in-flow). Ignored if `fixed` is true.

members.name: fixed
members.description: Fixed positioning (out-of-flow). Takes precedence over `sticky`/`static`.

members.name: revealOnScroll
members.description:
Sticky-only reveal behavior (hide on scroll down, show on scroll up).
- missing/false: disabled
- true/empty attribute: enabled with default threshold (16)
- number (as string): enabled and used as threshold

members.name: shrinkOffset
members.description:
Shrink trigger.
- missing/0: disabled
- number (px): shrink when scrollY >= that value (but never before header height)
- css var name (e.g. --foo): shrink when scrollY >= resolved var value
- selector (e.g. .page-title): shrink when that element scrolls out of view above the viewport

members.name: expandOnHover
members.description: If true, expand the header when hovered

attributes.name: static
attributes.description: Force static positioning (default). Ignored if `sticky` or `fixed` are true.

attributes.name: sticky
attributes.description: Sticky positioning (in-flow). Ignored if `fixed` is true.

attributes.name: fixed
attributes.description: Fixed positioning (out-of-flow). Takes precedence over `sticky`/`static`.

attributes.name: reveal-on-scroll
attributes.description:
Sticky-only reveal behavior (hide on scroll down, show on scroll up).
- missing/false: disabled
- true/empty attribute: enabled with default threshold (16)
- number (as string): enabled and used as threshold

attributes.name: shrink-offset
attributes.description:
Shrink trigger.
- missing/0: disabled
- number (px): shrink when scrollY >= that value (but never before header height)
- css var name (e.g. --foo): shrink when scrollY >= resolved var value
- selector (e.g. .page-title): shrink when that element scrolls out of view above the viewport

attributes.name: expand-on-hover
attributes.description: If true, expand the header when hovered

events.name: leHeaderState
events.description: Emits whenever scroll-driven state changes.

events.name: leHeaderShrinkChange
events.description: Emits when the header shrinks/expands (only on change).

events.name: leHeaderVisibilityChange
events.description: Emits when the header hides/shows (only on change).

declarations.description:
Placeholder for `le-header`.

Reserves space using the global CSS variable `--le-header-height`.
The header component updates that variable when it renders.
declarations.name: LeHeaderPlaceholder

Renders the SVG content out of a JSON data in a format:
{ "viewBox": "...", children: [{ "tag": "g", ""children": [ ... ], ...attrs }, ...] }

Name of the icon to display. Corresponds to a JSON file in the assets folder.
For example, "search" will load the "search.json" file.

attributes.description: Size of the icon in pixels. Default is 16.

events.name: leClose
events.description: Emitted when the dropdown closes.

declarations.description:
Navigation component with vertical (tree) and horizontal (menu) layouts.

- Accepts items as `LeOption[]` or a JSON string.
- Supports hierarchical items via `children`.
- Supports persisted expansion via `open` on items.
declarations.name: LeNavigation

slots.description: Custom trigger contents for the hamburger button
slots.name: hamburger-trigger

slots.description: Custom trigger contents for the "More" button
slots.name: more-trigger

members.name: items
members.description:
Navigation items.
Can be passed as an array or JSON string (same pattern as le-select).

members.name: orientation
members.description: Layout orientation.

members.name: wrap
members.description:
Horizontal wrapping behavior.
If false, overflow behavior depends on `overflowMode`.

members.name: overflowMode
members.description:
Overflow behavior for horizontal, non-wrapping menus.
- more: moves overflow items into a "More" popover
- hamburger: turns the whole nav into a hamburger popover

members.name: minVisibleItemsForMore
members.description:
Minimum number of visible top-level items required to use the "More" overflow.
If fewer would be visible, the navigation falls back to hamburger.

members.name: align
members.description: Alignment of the menu items within the navigation bar.

members.name: activeUrl
members.description: Active url for automatic selection.

members.name: searchable
members.description: Enables a search input for the vertical navigation.

members.name: searchPlaceholder
members.description: Placeholder text for the search input.

members.name: emptyText
members.description: Text shown when no items match the filter.

members.name: submenuSearchable
members.description: Whether submenu popovers should include a filter input.

members.name: overflowIds
members.description: IDs of items currently in overflow (from le-bar)

members.name: hamburgerActive
members.description: Whether hamburger mode is active (from le-bar)

members.name: overflowPopoverOpen
members.description: Whether the overflow popover is open

parameters.name:
{
      depth,
      pathPrefix,
      autoOpenIds,
      searchable,
      searchQuery,
      searchPlaceholder,
      emptyText,
      submenuId,
      closePopover,
    }

attributes.name: items
attributes.description:
Navigation items.
Can be passed as an array or JSON string (same pattern as le-select).

attributes.name: orientation
attributes.description: Layout orientation.

attributes.name: wrap

Horizontal wrapping behavior.
If false, overflow behavior depends on `overflowMode`.

attributes.name: overflow-mode

Overflow behavior for horizontal, non-wrapping menus.
- more: moves overflow items into a "More" popover
- hamburger: turns the whole nav into a hamburger popover

attributes.name: min-visible-items-for-more
attributes.description:
Minimum number of visible top-level items required to use the "More" overflow.
If fewer would be visible, the navigation falls back to hamburger.

attributes.description: Whether submenu popovers should include a filter input.

events.description:
Fired when a navigation item is activated.

This event is cancelable. Call `event.preventDefault()` to prevent
default browser navigation and implement custom routing.

events.description: Fired when a tree branch is toggled.

declarations.description:
A popover component for displaying floating content.

Uses the native HTML Popover API for proper layering with dialogs
and other top-layer elements. Falls back gracefully in older browsers.
declarations.name: LePopover

slots.description: Content to display inside the popover

members.name: mode
members.description: Mode of the popover should be 'default' for internal use

members.name: open
members.description: Whether the popover is currently open

members.name: position
members.description: Position of the popover relative to its trigger

members.name: align
members.description: Alignment of the popover

members.name: popoverTitle
members.description: Optional title for the popover header

members.name: showClose
members.description: Whether to show a close button in the header

members.name: closeOnClickOutside
members.description: Whether clicking outside closes the popover

members.name: closeOnEscape
members.description: Whether pressing Escape closes the popover

members.name: offset
members.description: Offset from the trigger element (in pixels)

members.name: width
members.description: Fixed width for the popover (e.g., '300px', '20rem')

members.name: minWidth
members.description: Minimum width for the popover (e.g., '200px', '15rem')

members.name: maxWidth
members.description: Maximum width for the popover (e.g., '400px', '25rem')

members.name: triggerFullWidth
members.description: Should the popover's trigger take full width of its container

members.name: updatePosition
members.description: Method to update the popover position from a parent component

members.name: getScrollParents
members.description: Find all scrollable parent elements

members.name: addScrollListeners
members.description: Add scroll listeners to all scrollable parents

members.name: removeScrollListeners
members.description: Remove scroll listeners

members.name: show
members.description: Opens the popover

members.name: hide
members.description: Closes the popover

members.name: toggle
members.description: Toggles the popover

declarations.description:
A flexible popup/dialog component for alerts, confirms, prompts, and custom content.

Uses the native HTML <dialog> element for proper modal behavior, accessibility,
and focus management. Can be used declaratively in HTML or programmatically
via leAlert(), leConfirm(), lePrompt().
declarations.name: LePopup

slots.description: Default slot for custom body content

members.name: mode
members.description: The mode of the Le Kit (e.g., 'default' or 'admin')

members.name: open
members.description: Whether the popup is currently visible

members.name: type
members.description: Type of popup: alert (OK only), confirm (OK/Cancel), prompt (input + OK/Cancel), custom

members.name: popupTitle
members.description: Optional title for the popup header

members.name: message
members.description: Message text to display (for alert/confirm/prompt types)

members.name: modal
members.description: Whether the popup is modal (blocks interaction with page behind)

members.name: position
members.description: Position of the popup on screen

members.name: confirmText
members.description: Text for the confirm/OK button

members.name: cancelText
members.description: Text for the cancel button

members.name: placeholder
members.description: Placeholder text for prompt input

members.name: defaultValue
members.description: Default value for prompt input

members.name: closeOnBackdrop
members.description: Whether clicking the backdrop closes the popup (modal only)

members.name: inputValue
members.description: Internal state for prompt input value

members.name: show
members.description: Opens the popup and returns a promise that resolves when closed

members.name: hide
members.description: Closes the popup with a result

attributes.name: close-on-backdrop

members.description:
Returns the viewPath attribute value for the SVG
based on the width of the parent element

members.name: getPath
members.description:
Returns the circular path for the progress stroke
and additional paths in the background

declarations.description:
Displays scroll progress as a simple bar.

If `track-scroll-progress` is present without a value, tracks the full document.
If it is a selector string, tracks progress within the matched element.
declarations.name: LeScrollProgress

cssProperties.description: If sticky, stop position to parent top
cssProperties.name: --le-scroll-progress-sticky-top

cssProperties.description: If fixed, distance from window top
cssProperties.name: --le-scroll-progress-fixed-top

cssProperties.description: If fixed, distance from window left
cssProperties.name: --le-scroll-progress-fixed-left

cssProperties.description: If fixed, distance from window right
cssProperties.name: --le-scroll-progress-fixed-right

cssProperties.description: Z-index of the progress bar (1001 by default, above header)
cssProperties.name: --le-scroll-progress-z

members.name: trackScrollProgress
members.description: Boolean or selector string.

attributes.name: track-scroll-progress
attributes.description: Boolean or selector string.

members.name: panelId
members.description:
Optional id used to match toggle requests.
If set, the panel only responds to toggle events with the same `panelId`.

members.name: side
members.description: Which side the panel is attached to.

members.name: collapseAt
members.description: Width breakpoint (in px or a CSS var like `--le-breakpoint-md`) below which the panel enters "narrow" mode.

members.name: narrowBehavior
members.description: Behavior when in narrow mode.

members.name: open
members.description:
Panel open state for narrow mode.
- overlay: controls modal drawer visibility
- push: controls whether panel is shown (non-modal)

members.name: collapsed
members.description: Panel collapsed state for wide mode (fully hidden).

members.name: panelWidth
members.description: Default panel width in pixels.

members.name: minPanelWidth
members.description: Minimum allowed width when resizable.

members.name: maxPanelWidth
members.description: Maximum allowed width when resizable.

members.name: resizable
members.description: Allows users to resize the panel by dragging its edge.

members.name: persistKey
members.description: When set, panel width + collapsed state are persisted in localStorage.

members.name: showCloseButton
members.description: Show a close button inside the panel (primarily used in narrow overlay mode).

members.name: autoShowOnWide
members.description: When crossing to wide mode, automatically show the panel (collapsed=false).

members.name: autoHideOnNarrow
members.description: When crossing to narrow mode, automatically hide the panel (open=false).

members.name: panelLabel
members.description: Accessible label for the panel navigation region.

Optional id used to match toggle requests.

Panel open state for narrow mode.
- overlay: controls modal drawer visibility
- push: controls whether panel is shown (non-modal)

attributes.name: resizable

attributes.name: show-close-button

members.description: Optional id used to target a specific panel.

members.name: action

declarations.description:
Slot placeholder component for admin/CMS mode.

This component renders a visual placeholder for slots when in admin mode,
allowing CMS systems to show available drop zones for content or inline editing.

In non-admin mode, this component renders nothing and acts as a passthrough.
declarations.name: LeSlot

slots.description: Default slot for placeholder content or drop zone UI

members.name: type
members.description:
The type of slot content.
- `slot`: Default, shows a dropzone for components (default)
- `text`: Shows a single-line text input
- `textarea`: Shows a multi-line text area

members.name: name
members.description:
The name of the slot this placeholder represents.
Should match the slot name in the parent component.

members.name: label
members.description:
Label to display in admin mode.
If not provided, the slot name will be used.

members.name: description
members.description:
Description of what content this slot accepts.
Shown in admin mode to guide content editors.

members.name: allowedComponents
members.description:
Comma-separated list of allowed component tags for this slot.
Used by CMS to filter available components.

members.name: multiple
members.description: Whether multiple components can be dropped in this slot.

members.name: required
members.description: Whether this slot is required to have content.

members.name: placeholder
members.description: Placeholder text for text/textarea inputs in admin mode.

members.name: tag
members.description:
The HTML tag to create when there's no slotted element.
Used with type="text" or type="textarea" to auto-create elements.

members.name: slotStyle
members.description:
CSS styles for the slot dropzone container.
Useful for layouts - e.g., "flex-direction: row" for horizontal stacks.
Only applies in admin mode for type="slot".

members.name: adminMode
members.description: Internal state to track admin mode

members.name: textValue
members.description: Internal state for text input value (synced from slot content)

members.name: isValidHtml
members.description: Whether the current textValue contains valid HTML

members.name: availableComponents
members.description: Available components loaded from Custom Elements Manifest

members.name: pickerOpen
members.description: Whether the component picker popover is open

members.name: slotRef
members.description: Reference to the slot element to access assignedNodes

members.name: slottedElement
members.description: The original slotted element (e.g., <h3 slot="header">)

members.name: isUpdating
members.description: Flag to prevent re-reading content right after we updated it

members.name: readSlottedContent
members.description: Read content from slotted elements via assignedNodes()

members.name: validateHtml
members.description: Validates if a string contains valid HTML

members.name: createSlottedElement
members.description:
Create a new slotted element when none exists.
The element is appended to the host component's light DOM.

members.name: loadAvailableComponents
members.description: Load available components from Custom Elements Manifest

members.name: formatComponentName
members.description:
Format a tag name into a display name
e.g., 'le-card' -> 'Card'

members.name: addComponent
members.description: Add a new component to the slot

members.name: handleSlotChange
members.description: Handle slot change event to re-read content when nodes are assigned

attributes.name: type
attributes.description:
The type of slot content.
- `slot`: Default, shows a dropzone for components (default)
- `text`: Shows a single-line text input
- `textarea`: Shows a multi-line text area

attributes.name: name
attributes.description:
The name of the slot this placeholder represents.
Should match the slot name in the parent component.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description:
Label to display in admin mode.
If not provided, the slot name will be used.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description:
Description of what content this slot accepts.
Shown in admin mode to guide content editors.

attributes.name: allowed-components
attributes.description:
Comma-separated list of allowed component tags for this slot.
Used by CMS to filter available components.

attributes.name: multiple
attributes.description: Whether multiple components can be dropped in this slot.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Whether this slot is required to have content.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: Placeholder text for text/textarea inputs in admin mode.

attributes.name: tag
attributes.description:
The HTML tag to create when there's no slotted element.
Used with type="text" or type="textarea" to auto-create elements.

attributes.name: slot-style
attributes.description:
CSS styles for the slot dropzone container.
Useful for layouts - e.g., "flex-direction: row" for horizontal stacks.
Only applies in admin mode for type="slot".

events.name: leSlotChange

type.text: EventEmitter<{ name: string; value: string; isValid: boolean }>

events.description:
Emitted when text content changes in admin mode.
The event detail contains the new text value and validity.

declarations.description:
A flexible stack layout component using CSS flexbox.

`le-stack` arranges its children in a row (horizontal) or column (vertical)
with configurable spacing, alignment, and wrapping behavior. Perfect for
creating responsive layouts.
declarations.name: LeStack

slots.description: Default slot for stack items (le-box components recommended)

members.name: direction
members.description: Direction of the stack layout

members.name: gap
members.description: Gap between items (CSS value like '8px', '1rem', 'var(--le-space-md)')

members.name: align
members.description: Alignment of items on the cross axis

members.name: justify
members.description: Distribution of items on the main axis

members.name: wrap
members.description: Whether items should wrap to multiple lines

members.name: alignContent
members.description: Alignment of wrapped lines (only applies when wrap is true)

members.name: reverse
members.description: Whether to reverse the order of items

members.name: maxItems
members.description: Maximum number of items allowed in the stack (for CMS validation)

members.name: fullWidth
members.description: Whether the stack should take full width of its container

members.name: fullHeight
members.description: Whether the stack should take full height of its container

members.name: padding
members.description: Padding inside the stack container (CSS value)

attributes.name: direction
attributes.description: Direction of the stack layout

attributes.name: gap
attributes.description: Gap between items (CSS value like '8px', '1rem', 'var(--le-space-md)')

declarations.description: A flexible tab component with multiple variants and states.
declarations.name: LeTab

members.name: mode
members.description: Mode of the popover should be 'default' for internal use

members.name: label
members.description: Label if it is not provided via slot

members.name: value
members.description: Value of the tab, defaults to label if not provided

members.name: variant
members.description: Tab variant style

members.name: position
members.description: Position of the tabs when used within a le-tabs component

members.name: size
members.description: Tab size

members.name: focusable
members.description:
Whether the tab can get focus
needed for accessibility when used in custom tab implementations

members.name: selected
members.description: Whether the tab is in a selected/active state

members.name: fullWidth
members.description: Whether the tab takes full width of its container

members.name: icon
members.description:
Icon only tab image or emoji
if this prop is set, the tab will render only the icon slot

members.name: showLabel
members.description: Whether to show the label when in icon-only mode

members.name: iconStart
members.description: Start icon image or emoji

members.name: iconEnd
members.description: End icon image or emoji

members.name: disabled
members.description: Whether the tab is disabled

members.name: href
members.description: Optional href to make the tab act as a link

members.name: target
members.description: Link target when href is set

members.name: align
members.description: Alignment of the tab label without the end icon

members.name: getTabConfig
members.description: Get tab configuration for parent component

events.name: click

Emitted when the tab is clicked.
This is a custom event that wraps the native click but ensures the target is the le-tab.

declarations.description:
A presentational tab bar component without panels.

Use this for navigation/routing scenarios where you manage the content
externally based on the selection events. For tabs with built-in panels,
use `le-tabs` instead.
declarations.name: LeTabBar

members.name: tabs
members.description: Array of tab options defining the tabs to display.

members.name: selected
members.description: The value of the currently selected tab.

members.name: fullWidth
members.description: Whether tabs should stretch to fill available width.

members.name: showLabels
members.description: Whether to show labels in icon-only mode.

members.name: position
members.description: Position of the tab bar.

members.name: size
members.description: Size of the tabs.

members.name: bordered
members.description: Whether to show a border below the tab bar.

members.name: tabConfigs
members.description: Internal tab configurations (built from children or tabs prop)

members.name: isDeclarativeMode
members.description: Whether we're using declarative mode (le-tab-panel children)

members.name: focusedIndex
members.description: Internal state for focused tab index (for keyboard navigation)

attributes.name: tabs
attributes.description: Array of tab options defining the tabs to display.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description: The value of the currently selected tab.

attributes.name: full-width
attributes.description: Whether tabs should stretch to fill available width.

attributes.name: show-labels
attributes.description: Whether to show labels in icon-only mode.

attributes.name: position
attributes.description: Position of the tab bar.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Size of the tabs.

attributes.name: bordered
attributes.description: Whether to show a border below the tab bar.

events.name: leTabChange
events.description: Emitted when the selected tab changes.

declarations.description:
A tab panel component used as a child of le-tabs.

Each le-tab-panel defines both the tab button label and the panel content.
The parent le-tabs component automatically reads these panels and creates
the tab interface.
declarations.name: LeTabPanel

members.name: label
members.description: The label displayed in the tab button.

members.name: value
members.description:
The value used to identify this tab.
Defaults to the label if not provided.

members.name: iconStart
members.description:
Icon displayed at the start of the tab button.
Can be an emoji, URL, or icon class.

members.name: iconEnd
members.description: Icon displayed at the end of the tab button.

members.name: disabled
members.description: Whether this tab is disabled.

members.name: lazy
members.description:
Whether to render the panel content only when active (lazy loading).
When true, content is not rendered until the tab is first selected.
When false (default), content is always in DOM but hidden when inactive.

members.name: active
members.description: Internal: Whether this panel is currently active (set by parent le-tabs)

members.name: hasBeenActive
members.description: Internal: Track if panel has ever been activated (for lazy rendering)

members.name: getValue
members.description: Get the effective value (value or label as fallback)

members.name: getTabConfig
members.description: Get tab configuration for parent component

members.name: setActive
members.description: Set the active state (called by parent le-tabs)

members.name: shouldRenderContent
members.description: Check if panel should render content

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The label displayed in the tab button.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
The value used to identify this tab.
Defaults to the label if not provided.

attributes.name: icon-start
attributes.description:
Icon displayed at the start of the tab button.
Can be an emoji, URL, or icon class.

attributes.name: icon-end
attributes.description: Icon displayed at the end of the tab button.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether this tab is disabled.

attributes.name: lazy
attributes.description:
Whether to render the panel content only when active (lazy loading).
When true, content is not rendered until the tab is first selected.
When false (default), content is always in DOM but hidden when inactive.

declarations.description:
A flexible tabs component for organizing content into tabbed panels.

Supports two modes:
1. **Declarative**: Use `<le-tab-panel>` children to define tabs and content
2. **Programmatic**: Use the `tabs` prop with named slots for content

Full keyboard navigation and ARIA support included.
declarations.name: LeTabs

slots.description: Default slot for le-tab-panel children (declarative mode)
Named slots for panel content (programmatic mode)
slots.name: panel-{value}

members.name: tabs
members.description:
Array of tab options (programmatic mode).
If le-tab-panel children exist, they take precedence.

members.name: selected
members.description:
The value of the currently selected tab.
If not provided, defaults to the first tab.

members.name: orientation
members.description: Orientation of the tabs.

members.name: position
members.description: Position of the tabs relative to the panels.

members.name: variant
members.description: Tab variant style.

members.name: fullWidth
members.description: Whether tabs should stretch to fill available width.

members.name: size
members.description: Size of the tabs.

members.name: wrap
members.description: Wrap the tabs if they exceed container width.

members.name: overflow
members.description: Scroll behavior for overflowing tabs.

members.name: tabConfigs
members.description: Internal tab configurations (built from children or tabs prop)

members.name: focusedIndex
members.description: Internal state for focused tab index (for keyboard navigation)

members.name: isDeclarativeMode
members.description: Whether we're using declarative mode (le-tab-panel children)

attributes.name: tabs
attributes.description:

If le-tab-panel children exist, they take precedence.

declarations.description: A tag/chip component for displaying labels with optional dismiss functionality.
declarations.name: LeTag

slots.description: Default slot for custom content (overrides label prop)

members.name: label
members.description: The text label to display in the tag.

members.name: mode
members.description: Mode of the popover should be 'default' for internal use

members.name: icon
members.description:
Icon to display before the label.
Can be an emoji, URL, or icon name.

members.name: dismissible
members.description: Whether the tag can be dismissed (shows close button).

members.name: disabled
members.description: Whether the tag is disabled.

members.name: size
members.description: The size of the tag.

members.name: variant
members.description: The visual variant of the tag.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The text label to display in the tag.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: Mode of the popover should be 'default' for internal use

attributes.name: icon
attributes.description:
Icon to display before the label.
Can be an emoji, URL, or icon name.

attributes.name: dismissible
attributes.description: Whether the tag can be dismissed (shows close button).

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the tag is disabled.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The size of the tag.

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description: The visual variant of the tag.

events.name: leDismiss
events.description: Emitted when the dismiss button is clicked.

declarations.description:
A text component with rich text editing capabilities in admin mode.

`le-text` renders semantic text elements (headings, paragraphs, code, quotes)
and provides a Notion-like rich text editor in admin mode with formatting
toolbar for bold, italic, links, and paragraph type selection.
declarations.name: LeText

members.name: variant
members.description: The semantic variant/type of text element

members.name: align
members.description: Text alignment

members.name: color
members.description: Text color (CSS value or theme token)

members.name: truncate
members.description: Whether the text should truncate with ellipsis

members.name: maxLines
members.description: Maximum number of lines before truncating (requires truncate=true)

members.name: adminMode
members.description: Internal state to track admin mode

members.name: content
members.description: The HTML content being edited

members.name: isFocused
members.description: Whether the editor is focused (shows toolbar)

members.name: selectionState
members.default: { isBold: false, isItalic: false, isUnderline: false, isStrikethrough: false, isLink: false, blockType: 'p', }
members.description: Current selection state for toolbar button highlighting

members.name: editorRef
members.description: Reference to the contenteditable element

members.name: slotRef
members.description: Reference to the slot element

members.name: readSlottedContent
members.description: Read content from slotted elements

members.name: syncContentToSlot
members.description: Sync edited content back to the slot

members.name: handleInput
members.description: Handle input in the contenteditable

members.name: handleFocus
members.description: Handle focus on the editor

members.name: handleBlur
members.description: Handle blur on the editor

members.name: handleSelectionChange
members.description: Handle selection change to update toolbar state

members.name: updateSelectionState
members.description: Update the selection state for toolbar highlighting

members.name: isSelectionInLink
members.description: Check if current selection is within a link

members.name: execCommand
members.description: Execute a formatting command

members.name: toggleBold
members.description: Toggle bold formatting

members.name: toggleItalic
members.description: Toggle italic formatting

members.name: toggleUnderline
members.description: Toggle underline formatting

members.name: toggleStrikethrough
members.description: Toggle strikethrough formatting

members.name: toggleLink
members.description: Add or edit a link

members.name: changeVariant
members.description: Change the block type/variant

members.name: renderToolbar
members.description: Render the formatting toolbar

members.name: getTag
members.description: Get the semantic tag for the current variant

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description: The semantic variant/type of text element
